input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I've been really tired and out of breath lately, and I feel weak even when I do normal things.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly when these symptoms first started and how they have changed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I think it started about two months ago? Or maybe a little more? It\u2019s kind of all blended together, but I\u2019ve just been feeling more tired than usual and more out of breath when I do things, even mild stuff. It\u2019s kind of gotten worse over time, I guess. I hadn\u2019t really thought about the exact day or anything, just that it\u2019s been a while now.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me how your symptoms have changed or varied from when they first started, and how severe they are now during daily activities?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess my symptoms haven't exactly gone away, but they do change a little. I started feeling really tired, and sometimes I get short of breath just walking around. There are days when I feel okayish, but other times I feel really weak, and my heart kind of races, especially if I try to do anything more than sit. It\u2019s been about two months now. I think sometimes it feels worse in the mornings, but then it gets a bit better later, I\u2019m not sure. So, I guess it\u2019s pretty constant, but it varies a bit."
]

input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I've been really tired and out of breath lately, and I feel weak even when I do normal things.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly when these symptoms first started and how they have changed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I think it started about two months ago? Or maybe a little more? It\u2019s kind of all blended together, but I\u2019ve just been feeling more tired than usual and more out of breath when I do things, even mild stuff. It\u2019s kind of gotten worse over time, I guess. I hadn\u2019t really thought about the exact day or anything, just that it\u2019s been a while now.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me how your symptoms have changed or varied from when they first started, and how severe they are now during daily activities?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess my symptoms haven't exactly gone away, but they do change a little. I started feeling really tired, and sometimes I get short of breath just walking around. I think sometimes it feels worse in the mornings, but then it gets a bit better later, I\u2019m not sure. So, I guess it\u2019s pretty constant, but it varies a bit.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me how these symptoms are affecting your daily activities\u2014are there things you used to do easily that you're now unable to do or find Difficult?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess it\u2019s kind of hard to do some things now that I used to do easily. Like, I get really tired just walking around or climbing stairs, and sometimes I feel like my heart races even if I\u2019m just sitting or doing nothing much. I\u2019ve been feeling pretty weak and sometimes dizzy, especially if I stand up quickly. It\u2019s made some daily stuff harder, I guess. Like, I don\u2019t really feel like going out or even doing chores because I get so tired or out of breath. I\u2019m not really sure what else to say about it."
]

input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I've been really tired and out of breath lately, and I feel weak even when I do normal things.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly when these symptoms first started and how they have changed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I think it started about two months ago? Or maybe a little more? It\u2019s kind of all blended together, but I\u2019ve just been feeling more tired than usual and more out of breath when I do things, even mild stuff. It\u2019s kind of gotten worse over time, I guess. I hadn\u2019t really thought about the exact day or anything, just that it\u2019s been a while now.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me how your symptoms have changed or varied from when they first started, and how severe they are now during daily activities?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess my symptoms haven't exactly gone away, but they do change a little. I started feeling really tired, and sometimes I get short of breath just walking around. There are days when I feel okayish, but other times I feel really weak, and my heart kind of races, especially if I try to do anything more than sit. It\u2019s been about two months now. I think sometimes it feels worse in the mornings, but then it gets a bit better later, I\u2019m not sure. So, I guess it\u2019s pretty constant, but it varies a bit.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me how these symptoms are affecting your daily activities\u2014are there things you used to do easily that you're now unable to do or find Difficult?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess it\u2019s kind of hard to do some things now that I used to do easily. Like, I get really tired just walking around or climbing stairs, and sometimes I feel like my heart races even if I\u2019m just sitting or doing nothing much. I\u2019ve been feeling pretty weak and sometimes dizzy, especially if I stand up quickly. It\u2019s made some daily stuff harder, I guess. Like, I don\u2019t really feel like going out or even doing chores because I get so tired or out of breath. I\u2019m not really sure what else to say about it.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you noticed any swelling in your legs or abdomen, or difficulty breathing when lying flat?",
  "PATIENT: Um, I guess I haven't really noticed if my legs or belly are swollen, and I don't really feel more short of breath lying down than before, but I do sometimes feel a little more tired when I walk or climb stairs.",
  "DOCTOR: Do you have any past medical conditions, like previous heart problems, bleeding issues, or chronic illnesses, that might be related to your current symptoms?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I guess I\u2019ve had heavy periods for a while, like about a week each time, and I\u2019ve been feeling really tired and out of breath when I do pretty much anything lately. Sometimes I feel dizzy too. I don\u2019t really have any heart problems or anything like that, just the heavy bleeding and feeling weak. I\u2019ve never had anything serious before, at least that I know of.",
  "DOCTOR: When you last had blood work done, did your doctor mention any low hemoglobin or iron levels, or have you noticed any paleness, especially in your skin or inside your mouth?",
  "PATIENT: Um, well, I think my doctor didn\u2019t specifically talk about my iron levels or hemoglobin when I had the blood work. I do remember feeling really tired and kinda dizzy sometimes, especially lately. I also noticed my skin and inside my mouth looked paler than usual. I guess I was just worried because I\u2019ve had heavy periods and I\u2019ve been feeling weak. I\u2019m not sure if that\u2019s what you mean, but I thought I should mention how I\u2019ve been feeling."
]
